Definitions.Paraphrase:
of marriage; of a husband and wife 
婚姻的；夫妻的 
He is faced with the fact of an irremediable marital breakdown. 
他面临着不可挽救的婚姻破裂的事实。
He did not appear to have any financial or marital problems. 
他看起来没有任何经济或婚姻问题。

happening before marriage 
婚前的
At that time, abortion, divorce, premarital sex, and drug trafficking were listed as serious sins. 
那时，流产、离婚、婚前性行为、贩卖毒品等都被列为重罪。

[U, C] very cold sweet food made from sugar and cream 
冰淇淋
The child likes ice-cream very much. 
这孩子喜欢冰淇淋。
The little girl had some ice-cream after dinner. 
这小姑娘饭后吃了些冰淇淋。
I like chocolate ice-cream best. 
我最爱吃巧克力冰淇淋。
Two chocolate-flavored ice-creams, please. 
请来两客巧克力口味冰淇淋。

1. [C] a set of things that have been collected 
收藏品，收集的东西
Her new book is a collection of short stories.  
她的新书是一本短篇小说集。
Our library has a large collection of books. 
我们图书馆的藏书很丰富。
Bob took his insect collection to school. 
鲍勃把他收集的昆虫带到了学校。
2. [U, C] collecting or gathering 
收集，收取
The photos will be ready for collection on Tuesday afternoon.  
照片可在星期二下午领取。
There are three collections a day from the post box on the corner.  
邮递员每天从拐角的邮筒里收取三次信件。

make certain of or prove the truth of (sth.) 
证明，证实，核实
These figures are surprisingly high and they'll have to be verified.  
这些数字高得惊人，必须予以核实。
Are you able to verify your theory?  
你能证明你的理论吗？

1. [C] a particular part of a written legal document 
条款，款项
There is a clause in the contract which says the company can fire people for economic reasons.  
合同中有一项条款说公司可以出于经济原因而裁减人员。
The last clause says that the payment should be made within a year.  
最后一项规定一年内付款。
2. [C] a group of words containing a subject and a verb, usu. forming only part of a sentence 
分句，从句
A clause can be introduced with "that " or "which". 
从句可以用that或which引导。

of a marriage or the state of being married 
婚姻的，结婚的
nuptial promises  
婚誓
the nuptial day 
结婚日

before getting married 
结婚前的 
prenuptial nerves  
婚前紧张 
There is growing concern about the increase in the number of prenuptial agreements.  
婚前协议的增加受到了越来越多的关注。

(pt., pp. bound)1. hold (people or things) together; unite 
连结，联合，结合
They have bound themselves by marriage.  
婚姻把他俩结合在一起。
We feel bound together by our past experiences.  
我们感到过去的经历把我们连在了一起。 
2. tie tightly 
捆绑，捆扎
They bound an umbrella to a pole to get some shade.  
他们将伞绑在柱子上以得到一些荫凉。
The prisoner was bound hand and foot.  
那名囚犯被绑住了手脚。
3. force sb. to obey, esp. by a law or a promise 
迫使，约束
The contract binds you to completion of the work within two years. 
根据合约，你必须在两年内完成这项工作。
He was bound to secrecy by the oath he took. 
他已发誓保守秘密。

1. [C, U] (act of) accepting or being accepted
接受，接纳
Since we sent out the invitations we've received five acceptances and one refusal.  
我们发出请柬后，得到的回复是五份接受一份拒绝。
I've had acceptance from the university.  
我已被大学录取。
2. [C, U] favor; approval
赞同，承认
The new laws gained widespread acceptance.  
新法律得到广泛的赞同。
The idea rapidly gained acceptance in political circles.  
这一想法很快得到了政界的认可。

1. [U] dividing or being divided 
分开，划分
A stream marks the division between the two farms.  
一条小溪隔开了两个农场。
This division of the world into the developed and underdeveloped nations is too simple.  
把世界划分为发达国家和不发达国家过于简单化了。
2. [C, U] disagreement between the members of a group 
分歧
Division within the party will limit its chances at the election.  
党内的意见分歧会降低竞选成功的可能性。
In fact, there is a division of opinion among the leaders of the movement.  
事实上，在运动领导人中间存在着意见分歧。
3. [C] one of the parts or groups in which a whole is divided
部门
She once worked in the foreign division of the company. 
她曾在公司的国外部工作过。
She works in the company's sales division. 
她在公司的销售部工作。

[C] a line of words printed in large letters as the title of a story in a newspaper, or the main points of the news that are broadcast on TV or radio 
标题；新闻提要
The news of his death was printed in headlines across all the newspapers.  
所有报纸都在标题位置刊登了他逝世的消息。 
I turned on the radio to get the eight o'clock headlines.  
我打开收音机听8点钟的新闻提要。

1. argue that sth. is not right 
质疑，辩驳
We will certainly contest any wrong claims made against the safety of our products.  
我们当然会驳斥任何针对我们产品安全性能的错误断言。
I intend to contest the judge's decision in another court.  
我要向另一个法庭对该法官的判决提出质疑。
2. (take part in and) try to win (sth.) 
争取，争夺；与……竞争
She stands a good chance since only two people are contesting the seat.  
只有两个人争夺这个位置，因此她大有希望获胜。
The firm is too small to contest with large companies.  
这家商行太小了，竞争不过大公司。

1. [C] a competition, usu. in which prizes are given 
竞赛，比赛
She's won a lot of beauty contests.  
她在许多选美大赛中获胜。
She won a gold medal in an international contest.  
她在国际比赛中获得一枚金牌。
2. [C] a struggle or fight to gain control or advantage 
争夺，竞争
There's a contest for a top management position in the company at the moment. 
目前，人们正在竞争该公司的一个高层管理职务。
The contest for leadership of the party is gathering speed. 
对党内领袖职务的争夺正在加剧。

[C] a person who is competing to get a job or position, or sb. who is taking an exam 
候选人；参加考试者
Candidates must write their names on the top page of the exam paper.  
参加考试者必须在试卷的头一页写上自己的名字。
Sixty percent of the candidates failed the examination.  
60%的考生没通过考试。

(pt., pp. stung)1. provoke by making one angry, painful, etc. 
激怒，刺痛
He was stung into making an angry reply.  
他被激怒，做出了愤怒的回答。
His words certainly stung her.  
毫无疑问，他的话刺伤了她。
2. wound with a sharp pain 
刺伤，蛰伤
A bee stung him on the arm.  
一只蜜蜂蛰了他的手臂。

[C] a sharp pain 
刺痛，刺伤
He felt a sting on his elbow as the spider jumped away.  
蜘蛛跳开时，他感到肘部有刺痛。
Her words carried a sting in them.  
她话中带刺。

[U, C] exposing or being exposed; an instance of this 
暴露，曝光，揭露
Exposure to the cold wind left my lips feeling dry. 
暴露在寒风中，我觉得嘴唇干裂。
Our dining room has a northern exposure, so it's rather cold.  
我们的饭厅朝北，所以相当冷。

1. [C] a local division of a larger organization 
支部，分会
That building is where the chapter meet on Thursdays.  
那幢房子是分会在星期四集会的地点。
2. [C] a division of a book 
章，回
The author devotes a separate chapter to the issue.  
作者单独用一章来阐述这一问题。
You have to wait until the last chapter to find out who the murderer was. 
你要等到看完最后一章才能搞清谁是凶手。

[C, U] an amount of money to pay or being paid 
支付的款项
When is the first payment due?  
第一期付款什么时候到期？
The man received little payment for his services.  
那人的服务只得到很少的报酬。

protect from harm; defend from criticism, attack, etc. 
防护，保护，庇护
She held her hand above her eyes to shield them from the sun.  
她举起手遮挡阳光以保护眼睛。
These trees will shield off winds and protect the fields.  
这些树林能挡住风，保护农田。

[C] sth. that is used as, or provides, protection
防护物，护罩，盾（状物）
The soldier's shield saved him from being killed by his enemy.  
那个士兵的盾牌保护他未被敌人杀死。
He must pile more sand on top as a shield.  
他必须在顶上多加些沙土作为防御物。

1. (cause to) give up one's regular work, esp. because of age 
(使)退休，(使)退役
They came back to England in 1991 to retire.  
他们于1991年退休回到英国。
I'm retiring after this tour.  
这次旅行以后我就准备退休。
2. go away to a quiet or less central place 
退下，离开
I retired to my study upstairs.  
我回到我楼上的书房。
After dinner our host said, "Shall we retire to the drawing room?"  
晚餐之后主人说道，"我们去客厅好吗？"

(of a person) having stopped working, usu. because of age
退休了的
My father is a retired teacher. 
我父亲是一位退休教师。

1. cause (a rule, law, etc.) to be obeyed, or carried out effectively
使生效，实施，执行
The new teacher totally failed to enforce any sort of discipline.  
新老师根本无法施行任何纪律。
There is a law against dropping litter but it is rarely enforced.  
禁止乱扔废物的法律是有的，但很少真正执行。
2. make (sth.) happen, esp. by threats or force 
强迫，迫使
They tried to enforce agreement with their plans. 
他们企图迫使人们同意他们的计划。
Illness enforced him to remain idle. 
疾病迫使他终日闲着。

[C] a word used before a noun or a pronoun to show its connection with another word 
介词
"In", "for" and "to" are all prepositions. 
in、for和to 全都是介词。
Sometimes a combination of a verb and a preposition has its own particular meaning. 
有时候动词和介词结合起来有特殊含义。

[C] a person who gives expert advice 
顾问
I think we need to see a computer consultant before we make an expensive mistake.  
为了避免犯代价过高的错误，我想我们应该请教一下电脑顾问。
She works for a firm of public relations consultants.  
她在一家公关咨询公司工作。

[C] a weapon with a long sharp metal blade and a handle, used esp. in the past 
剑
The sword snapped.  
剑突然折断了。
Stop! Put up your sword!  
住手！别打了！

1. [U, C] inviting; a request to go or come somewhere 
邀请；邀请信
We have been getting lots of invitations to parties lately.  
近来我们收到了不少参加聚会的请帖。
We have had to refuse the invitation to the wedding.  
我们不得不拒绝了参加婚礼的邀请。
2. [C] (usu. sing.) sth. which encourages sb. to do sth. 
引诱，诱惑
Leaving your house unlocked is an open invitation to burglars. 
门不上锁，就会引来窃贼。
Sad thoughts are an invitation to depression.  
消沉的想法会使人变得沮丧。

[C, U] a person's name written by himself; the action of signing sth. 
签名；签字
I couldn't read his signature. 
我看不清他的签名。
They returned her cheque because she hadn't put her signature on it. 
他们把支票退给了她，因为她没有在支票上签字。
We collected hundreds of signatures in support of not allowing cars into the city center.  
我们收集了数百个签名，支持禁止汽车进入市中心。
Signature of this document means that you agree with us.  
你在此文件上签名说明你同意我们的意见。

1. mention, esp. as an example in a statement, argument, etc.; quote 
引用，引证
She cited three reasons why people get into debt.  
她举出人们欠债的三个原因。
The lawyer cited a previous case to support his argument.  
律师援引一个先前的案例来证明他的论点。
2. praise (sb. in the armed forces) publicly because of their bravery 
（军队的）传令嘉奖
She was cited by the government for doing an outstanding piece of work.  
她因工作出色而受到政府的嘉奖。

1. causing anxiety or embarrassment 
困窘的，尴尬的
They'd chosen an awkward time to call as I'd just got into the bath.  
他们选了一个令人尴尬的时间打电话来，我刚开始洗澡。
The police asked some awkward questions about where the money had come from.  
警方对这笔钱的来路问了好几个令人发窘的问题。
2. difficult to use, do or deal with
难操纵的，使用不便的
Some of the questions were rather awkward, but I still enjoyed the exam.  
虽然有几道题相当难，但总的来说我考得还不错。
It was an awkward corner to get round, so take it slowly.  
这是一个不好转的弯，开慢些。
3. lacking skill in moving (parts of) the body 
笨拙的，不灵巧的
Seals are very awkward on land, but graceful in the water. 
海豹在陆地上很笨拙，但在水中却悠然自得。
The child was awkward with knife and fork. 
那孩子用刀叉不是很熟练。

prepare (a text or film) for printing or viewing by correcting mistakes and deciding what will be removed and what will be kept in, etc. or be in charge of (the reports in a newspaper or magazine, etc.) 
编辑，剪辑，校订
Janet fixed copies and edited books for a variety of publishers.  
珍妮特曾为不同的出版商审订稿件和编辑图书。
You will have to edit that tape — it's too long.  
那盘录音带太长，你得把它剪辑一下。

remove or draw a line through (esp. a written word or words ) 
删掉，划去（文字）
All references to racial problems were deleted from the history books.  
历史书里所有涉嫌种族问题的地方都被删掉了。
They insisted that all the praise had been deleted from the article.  
他们坚持说文章里所有的赞美语已被删掉了。

1. make or produce, esp. with some difficulty
锻造，锤炼；使形成
The accident forged a link between the two families.  
那次事故将两个家庭联系在了一起。
She forged a new career for herself as a singer.  
她开创了作为一名歌手的新事业。
2. make an illegal copy of sth. in order to cheat  
伪造，假冒，仿造
They are forging all kinds of documents to a high standard.  
他们伪造各种文件的水平很高。
He got the money by forging his brother's signature on a cheque.  
他在支票上假冒他哥哥的签名，得到了那笔钱。

[C, U] an argument or disagreement 
争端，分歧
They've been trying to settle the dispute over working conditions for the last three days.  
他们最近三天以来一直在努力解决有关工作条件的争端。
There's some dispute over who actually wrote the play — nobody seems to know for sure.  
对于实际上是谁写了这部戏有一些分歧——看上去没人确知这一点。

1. argue (about sth.), esp. angrily and for a long time
争论，争吵，辩论
The question was hotly disputed in the Senate. 
这个问题在参议院引起了激烈的争论。
The two countries have disputed over that stretch of land for years.  
两国为那片领土已争执多年。
2. disagree about or question the truth or correctness of 
对……表示异议，反对，辩驳
I dispute the minister's figures — the true cost of the project is much higher. 
我对部长提供的数据表示怀疑，因为工程的实际费用要比这高得多。
Nobody disputed that David was clever. 
没有人不认为大卫聪明。

[C] an official document or small book containing some personal information which is given to people by their own government to allow them to travel to foreign countries 
护照
Do you have to show your passport at the check-in desk? 
办理登机手续时须出示护照吗？
He was a German, but traveling on a Swiss passport.  
他是德国人，但持瑞士护照旅行。
As an American working in France, I was disgusted that my new-born daughter was not granted a French passport.  
作为一名在法国工作的美国人，我对不给予我刚出生的女儿一份法国护照这件事感到反感。

[C, U] an event connected with what is happening or has happened 
情形，情况，状况
We can't decide until we know all the circumstances.  
我们在了解所有情况以后才能做决定。
We were obliged to do it by force of circumstance.  
我们是形势所迫，不得不如此。

staying in one place without moving, or not changing for a long time 
静止的，不变的
The national birth rate has remained static for the last few years. 
全国出生率近几年来保持稳定。
He pointed out that a play is not a static object like a picture.  
他指出戏剧不像图片一样静止不动。

1. [U] relation or influence 
关系，影响
That had some bearing on our decision to move to another area of town.  
那件事与我们搬到镇上另一地区的决定有些关系。
Your remark didn't have any bearing on what happened.  
你的话与所发生的事情毫无关系。
2. (sing.) a way of standing, walking, etc. 
举止，姿态
She had a proud, distinguished bearing.  
她摆出一副傲慢而高贵的姿态。
He is a man of soldierly bearing.  
他的举止像军人。
3. [C] a direction or angle as shown by a compass
方位，方向
The road system was so complicated that we had to stop to take our bearings several times. 
公路网络如此复杂，我们好几次不得不停下来确定方位。
They lost their bearings in the dark. 
他们在黑暗中迷失了方向。

[U] a good reason for doing sth. 
正当的理由
It can be said, with some justification, that she is one of the greatest actresses on the English stage today.  
有理由说，她是当今英国舞台上最杰出的女演员之一。
I can see no justification for dividing the company into smaller units.  
我不明白有什么理由要把这家公司分成几个小公司。

1. [C] a disorderly pile or mass of things one on top of the other 
一堆
His clothes lay in heaps on the floor.  
他的衣服堆放在地板上。
We piled all the newspapers into a heap.  
我们把所有的报纸堆成一堆。
2. (often pl.) a lot 
大量，许多
We have heaps of time before the train leaves. 
离火车开之前，我们还有许多时间。
We have bought heaps of food for the picnic. 
我们为野餐买了许多食物。

put into a heap 
（使）堆起
He heaped the leaves up in the corner of the garden.  
他把树叶堆在花园的角落里。
They heaped the food onto our plates.  
他们在我们的盘子里堆满了食物。

(pt., pp. shed)1. produce (esp. tears, light or blood) 
流出，流下，发出
She shed a few tears at her daughter's wedding.  
她在女儿的婚礼上流下了眼泪。
The lamp sheds soft light on the desk.  
那盏灯把柔和的光洒在书桌上。
2. get rid of (sth. not needed or wanted) 
去掉，摆脱
The company yesterday announced that 900 jobs will be shed over the next few months.  
公司昨天宣布在接下来的几个月中将裁减900个职位。
I'd like to shed a few pounds before the summer. 
我希望能在夏天来临之前减轻几磅体重。
3. (of a plant or animal) have (leaves, skin, hair, etc.) come off or fall out naturally
脱落，脱去
These trees shed their leaves in fall. 
这些树秋天落叶。
In spring, when the weather is warmer, many animals shed their thicker winter coats.  
在天气变暖的春季，许多动物会脱落厚厚的冬季绒毛。

[C] a building, often made of wood, for storing things 
棚，小屋
a tool shed  
工具房
The farmer built a shed for his tractor next to the barn.  
那个农场主在谷仓边盖了一间拖拉机棚。

[C] a box-container without a top which is part of a piece of furniture 
抽屉
The desk has five drawers. 
这个书桌有五个抽屉。
There's some paper in the top drawer of my desk. 
我书桌最上面的那个抽屉里放了一些纸。
I keep my socks in the bottom drawer.  
我把袜子放在最底下的一个抽屉里。
You'll find my address book in the second drawer down.  
你可以在下面的第二个抽屉找到我的通讯录。

Definitions.PartofSpeech:
develop well; prove successful 
发展很好；证明是成功的
I'm sure things will work out for the best in the end.  
我相信事情最终会圆满解决的。
It's an interesting scheme, but do you really think it will work out?  
这是个有趣的方案，但你真的认为它会成功吗？

collect and keep sth. for future use 
收起来，储存，储备
Now it's time to store away your fur coats for the summer.  
夏天快到了，该把你的皮大衣收起来了。
This is where the animals store their nuts away.  
这就是动物储存坚果的地方。

1. strongly demand sth. or doing sth. 
坚决要求
He always insists on the best. 
他总是要求完美。
Don't let them tell you what they want, insist on your rights. 
别让他们告诉你他们想要什么，你得坚持要求自己的权利。
2. say firmly that sth. is true 
坚持认为
She insisted on her innocence. 
她坚持说她是清白的。
Throughout the trial, the prisoner insisted on his lack of guilt. 
在整个审判中，罪犯坚持说自己无罪。

do not have the slightest doubt; be quite sure  
别弄错了；毫无疑问
If you don't improve your behavior, you'll be punished; make no mistake about it.  
要是不改正你的行为，你将受到惩罚，这是毫无疑问的。
Make no mistake about it, you're bound to have an accident if you drive so fast down the motorway.  
毫无疑问，你要是在公路上开得这样快，准会出事。

get more of a particular quality 
得到更多的……
gain in confidence 
增强信心
Cyber bars have gained in popularity in recent years. 
网吧近年来越来越流行。
The Roman Empire gained in wealth and power throughout the first century AD. 
公元1世纪，罗马帝国得到了更多的财富和权势。

become important news in newspapers or on radio or television 
成为头条新闻
The arrival of the football team hit the headlines in the local press. 
足球队的到达成为当地报纸的头条新闻。
"Computer crime" first made the headlines in 1983. 
计算机犯罪在1983年首次成为头条新闻。

require, demand or need 
需求，要求
This trouble calls for quick action by the government.  
这一纷争需要政府立即采取行动来解决。
This sort of work calls for a lot of patience. 
这工作需要极大的耐性。

be likely to get 
即将获得，很可能得到
Who's next in line for promotion in your department?  
你那个部门下一位有希望得到晋升的是谁？
The men worked much harder when they heard that they were in line for a wage increase.  
那些人听说有希望长工资，干得起劲多了。

influenced by urgency or other form of pressure
在压力下，在强力下
He said that he made his statement to the police under pressure.  
他说他对警方的供述是迫于压力。
I'm under pressure to buy my wife a new coat.  
我迫不得已才去为妻子买了件新上衣。

1. write out 
写出，制定
The general has drawn up a plan to defeat the enemy.  
将军拟订了一个击败敌人的计划。
Has your lawyer drawn up the contract yet?  
你的律师是否起草好了合同？
2. (of a vehicle) arrive at a certain point and stop 
（使）停住
The car drew up at the gate and three men got out. 
汽车在门前停了下来，从车里走出三个人。
He drew up his car outside his house. 
他将车停在他家的外面。

issue; distribute 
发出，寄出
You can send out a call for help over the radio.  
你可以通过无线电发出求援信号。
Orders are taken by mail, and the goods are sent out from a central point where they are stored.  
定货单是邮寄来的，货物是从贮存中心发出去的。

do what sb. suggests 
采纳某人的意见
If you take my advice you'll see a doctor.  
如果你听我的劝告，就该去看医生。
You should take legal advice.  
你应该请教律师。

just in front of sb. 
就在... ...面前
The pen I thought I'd lost was on my desk, right under my nose.  
我以为丢了的笔就在书桌上，在我的眼皮底下。
I put the bill right under his nose so that he couldn't miss it.  
我把账单就放在他面前，以免他看不到。

quarrel over 
为……争论，争吵
Let us not argue over going out tonight.  
咱们别为今晚出门的事争吵了。
They are arguing over whether it is safe to sail in this weather.  
他们在争论在这种天气里出海是否安全。

1. start suddenly 
突然开始，爆发
Fire broke out in the hospital last night. 
昨夜医院突然发生了火灾。
War broke out in 1937.  
战争于1937年爆发。
2. escape from 
逃离
He broke out of the prison last night. 
他昨天晚上越狱而逃。

Extremely close to 
几乎，非常接近
Dinner's just about ready, so wash your hands now. 
晚餐快好了，去洗手吧。
I've just about finished with the newspaper; you can have it in a minute. 
报纸我快看完了，你马上就可以看了。

have sth. as the result 
导致
An ordinary cold can soon lead to a fever.  
普通感冒可能很快会引起发烧。
It's sleeping late in the morning that leads to being late for work. 
是早上睡懒觉导致上班迟到。

begin to discuss or deal with sth. 
开始讨论；着手处理
Without entering into the advantages and disadvantages, we can see that the plan is possible.  
我们不需要考虑所有的利弊，就可以看出这个计划是可行的。
Once you have reached informal agreement, you should enter into a contract with the other party.  
一旦达成非正式协议，就应该和对方签定合同。

have no relation to; have nothing to do with 
与……无关
How many kids you have has no bearing on how much tax you pay. 
你有几个孩子和你交多少税没有关系。
A suspect's criminal record should have no bearing on the trial. 
一名嫌疑犯的犯罪记录应该与审讯无关。

finish in a particular place or way 
结束，告终
He never dreamed that he would end up owning such a lot of property. 
他做梦也没想到他最后会拥有这么一大笔财产。
He'll end up in prison if he goes on behaving like that.  
如果他继续这样，终究会坐大牢的。

expose or make known sth. hidden 
揭示，说出
The director was careful not to lay the firm's plans bare.  
经理小心翼翼，不说出公司的计划。
The speaker accidentally laid bare the government's intention to raise taxes.  
演讲者无意中泄露了政府打算增加税收的意图。

make a problem, etc. easier to understand 
(使)更容易理解
These discoveries may shed light on the origins of the universe. 
这些发现会有助于理解宇宙的起源。
Scientists working in the Gobi Desert have shed new light on the life of dinosaurs. 
在戈壁滩上工作的科学家们使人们对恐龙的生活有了新的认识。
杰奎琳·肯尼迪·奥纳西斯
